Jordan's Islamists come under pressure
subhead: Since the popular Muslim Brotherhood movement was banned, one of its offshoots in Jordan, the Islamic Action Front, the largest party in parliament, has been threatened. The pressure also aims to isolate Hamas.

headline: Ahead of Trump-Putin meeting, Europeans reaffirm opposition to border changes 'by force'
Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un vow stronger ties ahead of US-Russia summit
Trump's takeover of Washington begins as National Guard troops arrive
subhead: About 850 federal law enforcement officers were deployed in Washington on Monday and arrested 23 people overnight, said White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt. The charges, she noted, included gun and drug crimes, drunk driving, subway fare evasion and homicide.

headline: Mexico extradites 26 people accused of drug trafficking to the United States
subhead: Under pressure from Donald Trump to combat fentanyl, Mexico is speeding up the extradition of drug traffickers.

headline: The love story between an old man and his 'great oak,' the tallest of its kind in the world
subhead: At the heart of Vallespir, in the Pyrénées-Orientales, Serge Arnaudiès discovered a 300- or 400-year-old cork oak. Recognized as the tallest in the world and labeled an 'Arbre remarquable' ('Remarkable Tree'), the specimen now draws many visitors.

headline: The golden age of Paris's techno clubs: 'Your brain switches off, your body follows the rhythm'
subhead: 'Why Do We Party?' (6/6). Once concentrated in mainstream nightclubs in central and western Paris, techno has spread to the city's industrial northeast, a shift that accelerated after the Covid pandemic.

Heat wave grips France again: '43°C, honestly, I didn't think that was possible'
subhead: Fourteen departments are under red alert on Tuesday and two-thirds of the country are under orange alert. Temperature records have been broken in southwest France.

headline: Three erotic experiences inspired by the internet
subhead: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she explores the possibilities created by AI, makes use of assistants (not necessarily digital ones) and as a seasoned archaeologist, exhumes an old website.

headline: Casablanca has become a safe haven for sub-Saharan migrants
subhead: Morocco's economic capital welcomes many immigrants from West Africa. Confronted with growing barriers to reaching Europe, some have chosen to settle in this metropolis, where they are 'tolerated.'
